message.content: A merism is a rhetorical device or figure of speech in which a whole is described by breaking it into its parts, often using an enumeration of the parts or some other method to represent the entirety of the subject. It can also involve listing a series of synonyms or near-synonyms to express a particular idea more forcefully. This technique allows for a comprehensive representation of an object or concept by detailing its constituent elements, making it easier for the reader or listener to understand and visualize the complete picture.
